meanings.definition: To build or form by putting together parts
meanings.sent1: I will stroy a model airplane from the kit.
meanings.sent2: The children love to stroy sandcastles at the beach.
meanings.sent3: He tried to stroy a house of cards, but it kept falling.
meanings.sent4: She managed to stroy a beautiful bouquet from the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The artist will stroy a sculpture from clay during the workshop.

meanings.sent1: The tornado will stroy the entire town in minutes.
meanings.sent2: The fire threatened to stroy the historic building.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to stroy the garden in no time.
meanings.sent4: The floodwaters began to stroy everything in their path.
meanings.sent5: The evil villain's plan was to stroy the hero's reputation.
